Sentencas: A dynamic model of an ammonia fed-tubular solid oxide fuel cell (NH3-SOFC) is developed and presented.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling and sensitivity analysis of a tubular SOFC fuelled with NH3 as a possible replacement for H2

Sentencas: The model accounts for diffusion, inherent impedance, transport (heat and mass transfer), electrochemical reactions, activation and concentration polarizations of electrodes and the ammonia decomposition reaction.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling and sensitivity analysis of a tubular SOFC fuelled with NH3 as a possible replacement for H2

Sentencas: Sensitivity analyses are conducted upon the effects of design parameters on the fuel cell performance.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling and sensitivity analysis of a tubular SOFC fuelled with NH3 as a possible replacement for H2

Sentencas: Dynamic output voltage, fuel-cell-tube temperature and efficiency responses to step changes in the inlet fuel flow pressure with different values of design parameters are discussed.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling and sensitivity analysis of a tubular SOFC fuelled with NH3 as a possible replacement for H2

Sentencas: It is found that among the studied parameters, the inner cell tube diameter has the strongest effect on fuel cell efficiency.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling and sensitivity analysis of a tubular SOFC fuelled with NH3 as a possible replacement for H2

Sentencas: On the other hand, the influence of cathodic porosity on fuel cell performance and transient response is higher than that of the anodic porosity.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling and sensitivity analysis of a tubular SOFC fuelled with NH3 as a possible replacement for H2

Sentencas: The transient response with different sizes of micro and macro-structures is studied and it is observed that changing the fuel cell length has the most effect.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling and sensitivity analysis of a tubular SOFC fuelled with NH3 as a possible replacement for H2

Sentencas: Also NH3-SOFC is compared with H-2-SOFC and it is found that the performance of the former is close to that of the latter thus signifying that ammonia is a suitable fuel for substituting in place of hydrogen.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling and sensitivity analysis of a tubular SOFC fuelled with NH3 as a possible replacement for H2
Dynamic modelling and sensitivity analysis of a tubular SOFC fuelled with NH3 as a possible replacement for H2
